intro: Racosperma truculentum, commonly known as the prickly wattle, is a shrub native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Racosperma truculentum plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
